column1: The '''House of Durin''' was the line of the descendants of [[Durin
column2: Durin the Deathless]], eldest of the seven [[Fathers of the Dwarves]].  The kingship of the line continued even when those with the title were in exile.<ref name="Durin">{{App

column1: ==The Family Tree of the House of Durin ==

Showing the descendants of Durin.  All information in the tree is from ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', Appendix A, "Durin’s Folk"<ref name="Durin"/> unless otherwise specified.  The figures after the names are those of birth and death where recorded (when only one figure is shown it is the date of birth).  A dagger symbol, '†' signifies those who did not die of old age.  A name preceded by '*' indicates one of the [[Kings of Durin's Folk]]; an ''italicized'' name  denotes one of the companions of [[Thorin]] on the quest of [[Lonely Mountain
column2: Erebor]].  A dashed line indicates a line of descent with some members missing.

column1: Of the other companions of Thorin Oakenshield in the quest of Erebor, ''Ori'', ''Nori'', and ''Dori'' were also of the House of Durin, but were more remote kinsman.  ''Bifur'', ''Bofur'', and ''Bombur'' were descended from Dwarves of Khazad-dûm but not of Durin's line.<ref name="Durin"/>
